title: Santa Bring My Baby Back (To Me)
text:
"Santa Bring My Baby Back (To Me)" is a 1957 Christmas song by Aaron Schroeder and Claude Demetrius, recorded by <a href="Elvis%20Presley">Elvis Presley</a>. The song was released on the RCA Victor "<a href="Elvis%27%20Christmas%20Album">Elvis' Christmas Album</a>" in 1957.
Background.
The song, written by Aaron Schroeder and Claude Demetrius, has been a popular Christmas song during the Holiday season on radio stations for decades. The song appeared originally as part of an RCA Victor 45 EP, EPA-4108, with "Santa Claus is Back in Town", "Blue Christmas", and "I'll Be Home for Christmas" in 1957. The EP reached #1 on the "Billboard" EP chart. The song was recorded on September 7, 1957 and features the vocal backing of <a href="the%20Jordanaires">the Jordanaires</a>.
"Santa Bring My Baby Back (To Me)" was paired with "Santa Claus Is Back In Town" and was issued as a UK single concurrently with the album's release in 1957. The single reached #7 on the UK Singles Chart in November 1957.
Album appearances.
The song appeared on the original RCA Victor LP, "Elvis' Christmas Album", the 1958 reissue, the 1970 RCA Camden reissue, the UK release of the Camden version, CDS 1155, the 1975 Pickwick reissue, and the 1985 RCA Special Products rerelease.
Cover versions.
"Baby Come Back," a song with the same melody and similar lyrics but without any references to Santa Claus or Christmas, was one of the earliest releases of <a href="Johnny%20Rivers">Johnny Rivers</a> in 1958.
In the 1965 <a href="Rolling%20Stones">Rolling Stones</a> documentary film "<a href="Charlie%20Is%20My%20Darling%20%28film%29">Charlie Is My Darling</a>", the song is sung impromptu by <a href="Mick%20Jagger">Mick Jagger</a> and <a href="Keith%20Richards">Keith Richards</a> in a hotel lounge.
<a href="Mae%20West">Mae West</a> recorded the song for her 1967 Christmas album "<a href="Wild%20Christmas">Wild Christmas</a>". <a href="The%20Reverend%20Horton%20Heat">The Reverend Horton Heat</a> recorded the song for his 2005 Christmas album "<a href="We%20Three%20Kings%20%28The%20Reverend%20Horton%20Heat%20album%29">We Three Kings</a>". <a href="Eleanor%20Friedberger">Eleanor Friedberger</a> released a cover version on the 2013 compilation album "<a href="Holidays%20Rule">Holidays Rule</a>".
The song has also been recorded or performed by <a href="The%20Smithereens">The Smithereens</a>, <a href="The%20Refreshments%20%28Swedish%20band%29">The Refreshments</a>, Jeff Healey, 45 R.P.M., Arena Venus, Kim Stockwood, Terry Buchwald, <a href="Chris%20Isaak">Chris Isaak</a>, <a href="Jimmy%20%26quot%3BOrion%26quot%3B%20Ellis">Jimmy "Orion" Ellis</a>, Janice Hagan, Rick Saucedo, and Tony Witt.
<a href="Train%20%28band%29">Train</a> recorded the song for their 2015 album "<a href="Christmas%20in%20Tahoe">Christmas in Tahoe</a>".
